<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_quiesce_daemon:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN MHD_socket
MHD_quiesce_daemon (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  unsigned int i;
#endif
  MHD_socket ret;

  ret = daemon->listen_fd;
  if ((MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == ret)
      || daemon->was_quiesced)
    return MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
  if ( (0 == (daemon->options & (MHD_USE_ITC))) &&
       MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon) )
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Using MHD_quiesce_daemon in this mode " \
                 "requires MHD_USE_ITC.\n"));
#endif
    return MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
  }

#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  if (NULL != daemon->worker_pool)
    for (i = 0; i < daemon->worker_pool_size; i++)
    {
      daemon->worker_pool[i].was_quiesced = true;
#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT
      if (MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_ (daemon) &&
          (-1 != daemon->worker_pool[i].epoll_fd) &&
          (daemon->worker_pool[i].listen_socket_in_epoll) )
      {
        if (0 != epoll_ctl (daemon->worker_pool[i].epoll_fd,
                            EPOLL_CTL_DEL,
                            ret,
                            NULL))
          MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to remove listen FD from epoll set.\n"));
        daemon->worker_pool[i].listen_socket_in_epoll = false;
      }
      else
#endif
      if (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->worker_pool[i].itc))
      {
        if (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->worker_pool[i].itc, "q"))
          MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to signal quiesce via inter-thread " \
                        "communication channel.\n"));
      }
    }
#endif
  daemon->was_quiesced = true;
#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_ (daemon) &&
      (-1 != daemon->epoll_fd) &&
      (daemon->listen_socket_in_epoll) )
  {
    if ( (0 != epoll_ctl (daemon->epoll_fd,
                          EPOLL_CTL_DEL,
                          ret,
                          NULL)) &&
         (ENOENT != errno) )   /* ENOENT can happen due to race with
                                  #MHD_epoll() */
      MHD_PANIC ("Failed to remove listen FD from epoll set.\n");
    daemon->listen_socket_in_epoll = false;
  }
#endif
  if ( (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->itc)) &&
       (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->itc, "q")) )
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("failed to signal quiesce via inter-thread " \
                  "communication channel.\n"));
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>

explanation:
Fragments not listed do not present cases where a pointer could reasonably be made to point to a const-qualified type. Specifically:
- The function parameter 'struct MHD_Daemon *daemon' and subsequent uses modify members (e.g. daemon->was_quiesced, worker_pool[i].was_quiesced), so the pointer must not be const.
- Accesses to daemon->worker_pool and its elements are used for mutation (setting flags, closing descriptors, toggling booleans), so those pointers cannot be const-qualified.
- Integer and boolean variables (ret, i, flags like listen_socket_in_epoll) are not pointer types and are not relevant to Rule 8.13.
- The NULL arguments passed to epoll_ctl are null pointer constants; while epoll_ctl takes a pointer parameter, passing NULL is intentional for the DEL operation and does not indicate a missing const-qualification in this source code itself.
- Macro invocations and condition checks (MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_, MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_, MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_) are predicates and do not by themselves indicate pointer const-qualification issues beyond the explicit calls and string literals already listed.
- Other string/macro usages not listed either are passed through macros where the callee's prototype may already accept const, or they are not pointer-type usages that could be made const without further context.

The listed suspicious fragments include all places in this function where string literals or pointer arguments are passed to functions/macros (e.g. MHD_itc_activate_, MHD_PANIC, MHD_DLOG) and the two epoll_ctl calls where a pointer parameter is involved; these should be investigated to verify whether the receiving declarations accept const-qualified pointer types as required by MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
